summary: The Hemp Economic Mobilization Plan Act of 2025 (HEMP Act of 2025) amends the Agricultural Marketing Act of 1946 regarding hemp production. It modifies the definition of hemp by increasing the allowable delta-9 THC concentration from 0.3% to 1%. It also establishes requirements for testing and documentation during hemp transport, including certification of THC levels and proof of licensing. Finally, it mandates the Secretary of Agriculture to revise relevant regulations within 90 days to reflect these changes.
